docs.abstract: Binary thinking in politics, race and inequality has distracted us from processing everything else that takes place in the country.
docs.snippet: Binary thinking in politics, race and inequality has distracted us from processing everything else that takes place in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: I am sad to announce that this will be the last edition of this newsletter. This decision was mine, and it was a difficult one to make because I’ve enjoyed the interactions I’ve had with you, my readers. Your emails and messages have made this, without question, the most enjoyable and satisfying writing gig of my career.

docs.abstract: The president issued a thinly veiled threat to anyone planning to demonstrate at his campaign rally on Saturday, but drew no distinction between peaceful protesters and “looters or lowlifes.”
docs.snippet: The president issued a thinly veiled threat to anyone planning to demonstrate at his campaign rally on Saturday, but drew no distinction between peaceful protesters and “looters or lowlifes.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump struck a combative stance on Friday for the holiday dedicated to the end of slavery, issuing a thinly veiled threat against protesters who have been marching against systemic racism and may show up at his campaign rally on Saturday in Tulsa, Okla., and warning that disruptions would not be tolerated.

headline.main: Trump’s Juneteenth Tweet: A Warning to Protesters at His Tulsa Rally
headline.print_headline: Trump Lumps Peaceful Protesters In With ‘Looters’ in Twitter Threat

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Michael D. Shear

docs.abstract: It’s a largely symbolic document that broadly outlines the party’s agenda. It doesn’t make everyone happy.
docs.snippet: It’s a largely symbolic document that broadly outlines the party’s agenda. It doesn’t make everyone happy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats on Tuesday night officially approved a new party platform, outlining a sweeping set of policies on key issues including health care, climate change and the economy.

headline.main: What the Democratic Party Platform Actually Says

byline.original: By Sydney Ember and Matt Stevens

docs.abstract: The monument has emerged from obscurity in the last few weeks, as four prominent memorials to the Confederacy in New Orleans were pulled down amid protests.
docs.snippet: The monument has emerged from obscurity in the last few weeks, as four prominent memorials to the Confederacy in New Orleans were pulled down amid protests.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS — The angry, divisive fight over public symbols of the Confederacy has swept through Columbia, S.C., Birmingham, Ala., and New Orleans. This week, the debate made its way some 600 miles north, up the Mississippi River, to St. Louis, the home of a Confederate memorial many residents did not know was in their midst.

headline.main: Few in St. Louis Knew Confederate Memorial Existed. Now, Many Want It Gone.
headline.print_headline: In Popular Park, a Point of Contention

docs.abstract: Samira Nasr, a former Vanity Fair fashion director, is leaving Condé Nast to take a key job at Hearst Magazines.
docs.snippet: Samira Nasr, a former Vanity Fair fashion director, is leaving Condé Nast to take a key job at Hearst Magazines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hearst Magazines named Samira Nasr as the next editor of the U.S. edition of Harper’s Bazaar on Tuesday, the first time that a woman of color will hold the top job at the 153-year-old fashion publication.

headline.main: Harper’s Bazaar Appoints First Woman of Color as Top Editor
headline.print_headline: Harper’s Bazaar Picks First Woman of Color as Top Editor

docs.abstract: Their plan to appear together over the last weekend before the primary, appears aimed at creating a bloc against the presumed front-runner, Eric Adams.
docs.snippet: Their plan to appear together over the last weekend before the primary, appears aimed at creating a bloc against the presumed front-runner, Eric Adams.

headline.main: Yang and Garcia Announce Plans to Campaign Together
headline.print_headline: Yang and Garcia Plan To Join Forces for a Day On the Campaign Trail

byline.original: By Michael Gold, Jeffery C. Mays and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

docs.abstract: The Birmingham minister understood white ambivalence about racism.
docs.snippet: The Birmingham minister understood white ambivalence about racism.
docs.lead_paragraph: During my research for a civil-rights history of Birmingham, Ala., a coveted source was proving elusive: the Rev. Wyatt Tee Walker, who had been the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s chief of staff during the 1963 demonstrations at my story’s climax — and who died on Tuesday at age 88.

headline.main: Wyatt Tee Walker, Civil Rights Oracle

docs.abstract: In addition to declaring solidarity, the fast-food industry could make changes to protect the health and safety of black employees.
docs.snippet: In addition to declaring solidarity, the fast-food industry could make changes to protect the health and safety of black employees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, Gushers and Fruit by the Foot, two fruit candies from the 1990s, now manufactured by General Mills, joined forces on Twitter to announce a deep commitment to … something.

headline.main: Food Brands Tweet #BlackLivesMatter, but What’s Behind the Words?
headline.print_headline: Food Brands Post Tweets, But What Do They Mean?

docs.abstract: Congress appears to have averted economic disaster for now, but only by punting it to early December.
docs.snippet: Congress appears to have averted economic disaster for now, but only by punting it to early December.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

headline.main: Why Does Congress Keep Playing Chicken With the Debt Ceiling?

docs.abstract: As a Black man and a public servant, I see that spectacle is drowning out the voices that need to be heard to make positive change.
docs.snippet: As a Black man and a public servant, I see that spectacle is drowning out the voices that need to be heard to make positive change.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the horrendous killing of George Floyd, people in Portland, Ore., joined with thousands across the country in demonstrations to address police reform and widespread systemic racism. The leaders of the Portland Police Bureau denounced this tragic death, and we reiterated our willingness to engage in reforms.

headline.main: I’m the Police Chief in Portland. Violence Isn’t the Answer.
